member.name: IDWriteGdiInterop.ConvertFontFaceToLOGFONT
member.summary: Initializes a LOGFONT structure based on the GDI-compatible properties of the specified font.
member.param: An object to be converted into a GDI-compatible LOGFONT structure.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a structure that receives a GDI-compatible font description.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDWriteGdiInterop.ConvertFontToLOGFONT
member.summary: Initializes a LOGFONT structure based on the GDI-compatible properties of the specified font.
member.param: An object to be converted into a GDI-compatible LOGFONT structure.
When this method returns, contains a structure that receives a GDI-compatible font description.
When this method returns, contains TRUE if the specified font object is part of the system font collection; otherwise, FALSE.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDWriteGdiInterop.CreateBitmapRenderTarget
member.summary: Creates an object that encapsulates a bitmap and memory DC (device context) which can be used for rendering glyphs.
member.param: A handle to the optional device context used to create a compatible memory DC (device context).
The width of the bitmap render target.
The height of the bitmap render target.
When this method returns, contains an address of a pointer to the newly created object.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDWriteGdiInterop.CreateFontFaceFromHdc
member.summary: Creates an IDWriteFontFace object that corresponds to the currently selected HFONT of the specified HDC.
member.param: A handle to a device context into which a font has been selected. It is assumed that the client has already performed font mapping and that the font selected into the device context is the actual font to be used for rendering glyphs.

Contains an address of a pointer to the newly created font face object, or NULL in case of failure. The font face returned is guaranteed to reference the same physical typeface that would be used for drawing glyphs (but not necessarily characters) using ExtTextOut.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDWriteGdiInterop.CreateFontFromLOGFONT
member.summary: Creates a font object that matches the properties specified by the LOGFONT structure.
member.param: A structure containing a GDI-compatible font description.
When this method returns, contains an address of a pointer to a newly created object if successful; otherwise, NULL.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDWriteGdiInterop
member.summary: Provides interoperability with GDI, such as methods to convert a font face to a LOGFONT structure, or to convert a GDI font description into a font face. It is also used to create bitmap render target objects.
